sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"进攻，侵略"之意。
means: aggression ：词义宽泛，既可指武装入侵别国领土，又可指文化、经济等方面的侵略。侧重敌意行动和征服的企图。
invasion ：多指具体的侵入或侵犯别国领土，也可用于指抽象事件。
assault ：主要指突然而猛烈的进攻。
attack ：普通用词，含义广，指事先不发警告，主动地向对方发起武力进攻或对言论等进行抨击。
offensive ：多指进攻的态势，常指大规模的协同军事行动。

word_mean: 发作：疾病的发作或发生

sentence.Network_en: Bob died of a heart attack, brought on by his lifestyle.
sentence.Network_cn: 鲍勃死于由他的生活方式引起的心脏病突发。

sentence.Network_en: His family was subjected to a hideous attack by the gang.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的家人遭到了匪帮的恐怖袭击。

sentence.Network_en: He renewed his attack on government policy towards Europe.
sentence.Network_cn: 他重新开始对政府的欧洲政策进行抨击。

常用临床医学英文术语 ... remission 缓解 attack 发作 rehabilitation 康复.

list.abs: 一些攻击者（attackers）暗中监视互联网的多个部分，使用高级的统计技术追踪许多不同的组织和个人的通信模式。加密并不能抵御 …
排球专业术语的英语表达_百度知道 ... 攻球 attack 攻击手 attacker 攻击性发球 attacking shot.
S . commanders say overall attacks in Iraq are down about 60 percent since June ., 美军指挥官说 , 六月份以来 , 伊拉克袭击事件的总数量下降了大约 60%.
It was one of two shark attacks in Australia that same day ., 这是同一天在澳大利亚发生两起鲨鱼攻击事件中的一起.

jx.jx_en_mean: subject to aggressive, violent, or harmful action

lj.lj_ly: the north-western suburbs came under attack in the latest fighting.
lj.lj_ls: 西北郊在最近的战斗中遭到攻击。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from French attaque (noun), attaquer (verb), from Italian attacco 'an attack', attaccare 'join battle', based on an element of Germanic origin (see attach)

encyclopedia.content: 读音释义 attack 美音：[ə'tæk]英音：[ə'tæk] 1攻击 2非难，抨击； 辱骂 3着手，投入，从事 4（疾病）侵袭 5腐蚀，侵蚀 attack the enemy . 攻打敌人 a disease that attacks children . 侵袭儿童的疾病 He tried to attack the problem. 他设法解决这个问题。 The hungry boy attacked his dinner as soon as it was served. 饭刚刚摆好，这个饥饿的男孩就狼吞虎咽地吃起来。 He was atta

entry.def: To attack a person or place means to try to hurt or damage them using physical violence.

example.ex: Fifty civilians in Masawa were killed when government planes attacked the town...
example.tran: 马萨瓦市遭到政府军飞机轰炸，有50名平民丧生。

example.ex: He bundled the old lady into her hallway and brutally attacked her...
example.tran: 他将老妇人推到她家走廊上，并对她一顿暴打。

entry.def: If you attack a person, belief, idea, or act, you criticize them strongly.

example.ex: He publicly attacked the people who've been calling for secret ballot nominations...
example.tran: 他公开抨击了那些主张用不记名投票方式确定任命人选的人。

example.ex: A newspaper ran an editorial attacking him for being a showman.
example.tran: 一家报纸发表社论，批评他善于作秀。

entry.tran: （疾病、化学药品、昆虫等）攻击，侵蚀，破坏
entry.def: If something such as a disease, a chemical, or an insect attacks something, it harms or spoils it.

example.ex: The virus seems to have attacked his throat...
example.tran: 病毒看来已经侵蚀到他喉部了。

example.ex: Several key crops failed when they were attacked by pests.
example.tran: 一些主要农作物由于遭受虫害而歉收。

entry.def: If you attack a job or a problem, you start to deal with it in an energetic way.

example.ex: Any attempt to attack the budget problem is going to have to in some way deal with those issues.
example.tran: 要解决预算问题，在某种程度上就必须解决那些问题。

entry.def: In games such as football, when one team attacks the opponent's goal, they try to score a goal.

example.ex: Now the US is controlling the ball and attacking the opponent's goal...
example.tran: 现在美国队控球，向对方球门展开了进攻。

example.ex: The goal was just reward for Villa's decision to attack constantly in the second half.
example.tran: 在下半场，维拉队持续进攻的打法为他们赢得了这个进球。

entry.def: An attack of an illness is a short period in which you suffer badly from it.

example.ex: It had brought on an attack of asthma.

means.word_mean: 1. (military) an offensive against an enemy (using weapons);

sentences.sentence: "the attack began at dawn"

means.word_mean: 2. a sudden occurrence of an uncontrollable condition;

sentences.sentence: "an attack of diarrhea"
"Clinton directed his fire at the Republican Party"
"the government has come under attack"
"don't give me any flak"
"attacks on women increased last year"
"they made an attempt on his life"

means.word_mean: 5. an offensive move in a sport or game;

sentences.sentence: "they won the game with a 10-hit attack in the 9th inning"

means.word_mean: 6. the onset of a corrosive or destructive process (as by a chemical agent);

sentences.sentence: "the film was sensitive to attack by acids"
"open to attack by the elements"

means.word_mean: 7. ideas or actions intended to deal with a problem or situation;

sentences.sentence: "his approach to every problem is to draw up a list of pros and cons"
"an attack on inflation"
"his plan of attack was misguided"

means.word_mean: 8. a decisive manner of beginning a musical tone or phrase

sentences.sentence: "he published an unexpected attack on my work"

means.word_mean: 1. launch an attack or assault on; begin hostilities or start warfare with;

sentences.sentence: "Hitler attacked Poland on September 1, 1939 and started World War II"
"Serbian forces assailed Bosnian towns all week"
"The editors of the left-leaning paper attacked the new House Speaker"

means.word_mean: 3. take the initiative and go on the offensive;

sentences.sentence: "The Serbs attacked the village at night"
"The visiting team started to attack"
"The mugger assaulted the woman"
"Nightmares assailed him regularly"

means.word_mean: 5. set to work upon; turn one's energies vigorously to a task;

sentences.sentence: "I attacked the problem as soon as I got out of bed"
"The cancer cells are attacking his liver"
"Rust is attacking the metal"

auth_sentence.res_content: The attack left a psychological scar on the community.

auth_sentence.content: This was expected criticism from a regime under attack.
auth_sentence.res_content: This was expected criticism from a regime under attack.

tack钉子,接角→n.平头打 v.钉住

Sentence.sentence: According to Arne Sorenson, the president of Marriott hotels, the current recession hit his business as hard as the 9/11 terrorist attack.
hit his business as hard as the 9/11 terrorist attack
It's a learning experience that attacks you from multiple sensory directions.
Monsanto's critics have attacked the company for its "merciless legal battles against small farmers," and they are hoping this will be the case that puts it in its place.
Janet James was 22 years old when she was diagnosed with MS—a disease that attacks the body's nerves.
The jury believed the testimony of the two victims, who positively identified Jackson as the man who has attacked them.

means.word_mean: 攻击, 袭击 进攻; （在战争中使用武器的）进攻, 攻击

sentences.en: They knew when to attack and when to retreat.
sentences.cn: 他们知道什么时候进攻和什么时候撤退。

sentences.en: The enemy attacked us at night.
sentences.cn: 敌人在夜间袭击了我们。

means.word_mean: 攻击, 袭击; （在战争中使用武器的）进攻, 攻击

sentences.en: The enemy attack took us by surprise.
sentences.cn: 敌人的进攻使我们感到意外。

sentences.en: She had her first heart attack the other day.
sentences.cn: 不久前, 她第一次心脏病发作。

jushi.english: They knew when to attack and when to retreat.
jushi.chinese: 他们知道什么时候进攻和什么时候撤退。

jushi.english: Make a feint to the east but attack in the west.
They were attacking just as hard as before.
jushi.chinese: 他们进攻得还是像以前那样猛烈。
